results.title: Craving

results.title: Nagara sutta - The City
results.description: The Buddha recounts how he attained full awakening by examining the principle of dependent co-arising. He likens this realization to a man discovering an ancient, forgotten city.
results.contentSnippet: Then, bhikkhus, this thought occurred to me: ‘What is it that, when present, leads to birth? ... leads to |existence::being, becoming; continued conditional existence, the karmically conditioned mode

results.title: Self Erasure
results.description: A craving to end suffering through erasure of current experience or identity, e.g. “This self is unbearable; I want out.”

results.title: Non Identification
results.description: A quality of mind that does not construct or fabricate a sense of self in relation to experience. It is the absence of the 'I am this' identification—neither claiming ownership nor defining oneself th
synonyms: lit. not made of that state

results.title: Greed
results.description: A grasping mental quality of craving, possessiveness, or lustful wanting that clings to objects or experiences; it fuels attachment and obstructs renunciation and contentment

results.title: Unwise attention
results.description: Attention that misses the point of contact, fixating on concepts or features. Disconnected from the source of experience, it then engages in reactions of craving, aversion, and delusion.

results.title: Recognition of diversity
results.description: The perception of multiplicity and variety in experience—seeing distinct forms, beings, and phenomena as separate entities. While natural to ordinary cognition, when fueled by craving and conceit it p

results.title: Āhāra sutta - Nutriment
results.description: The Buddha explains the four kinds of nutriments that sustain beings that are existing and support those seeking birth, and how they arise from craving.

results.title: Felt Experience
results.description: Pleasant, neutral, or painful sensation—the experience felt on contact. Sometimes translated as “feeling.” Distinct from an emotional state or reaction, it refers to the affective tone of experience,

assertions.reason: Topic with both terms in description should rank reasonably high
ITI 53 (both terms) should rank above ITI 58 (only craving)
